text-support: If you have any questions about Lymbrarie or would like to report a bug, please contact this email.

please-come-back-later: Please come back later. I promise not to take long!
unknown: An unexpected error occurred, please reload the website and verify your connection. If the error persists, report it to this email:
donations-text: This project is the effort of a single person. If you enjoy using Lymbrarie and want it to continue, please consider making a donation. Your contribution makes a difference!
text-offline: You need an internet connection to add, edit, or delete a book.
book-find: Where every book finds its place. Organize and manage your personal library with ease.
privacy-1: At Lymbrarie, we respect your privacy. Therefore, only your name, email and user photo are used. These data are used exclusively to identify you, synchronize your preferences and book collection.
privacy-2: Your personal information is not shared, sold or disclosed to third parties without your express consent, except as required by law.
privacy-3: Your information is protected by appropriate security measures. We are committed to the security and confidentiality of your data.
privacy-4: If you have any questions, please contact this email:
error-wifi-notes: Offline. If you exit now, you will lose unsaved changes.
error-save-notes: An error occurred while saving your notes!
copy-notes: Please copy and save them elsewhere to avoid losing changes and try again later.
answer-1: Lymbrarie is your personal library. Think of it as a bookshelf with all your books, but in digital format. You can add the books you want, organize your reading, add notes, create a list of favorites and much more.
question-2: How many books can I add?
answer-2: You can add as many books as you want, without any limit.
answer-3: Lymbrarie is maintained thanks to donations from users who support the project. They allow us to offer an experience without ads or subscriptions.
question-4: Is my personal data safe on Lymbrarie?
answer-4: Yes, all your information, such as your books and preferences, is private and is not shared with third parties. For more details, please see our privacy policy.
question-5: Does Lymbrarie have a mobile application?
answer-5: For now, Lymbrarie does not have an official mobile application, but plans are underway to develop one for Android. In the meantime, you can install the web version directly from your browser, both on PC and mobile.
login-error: An error occurred while logging in
manage-library: The best way to manage your Library
organize-descp: Easily catalog and organize your books with sorting and filtering options.
tracking-descp: Track your reading progress and get relevant data on your reading.
discover-descp: Explore new books and authors with personalized recommendations.
terms-1: 1. By accessing and using our services, you agree to comply with these terms of use. If you do not agree with any part of these conditions, we recommend that you do not use the platform.
terms-2: The use of Lymbrarie for illegal, fraudulent or infringing activities of third parties is not allowed.
terms-3: 3. We reserve the right to suspend or terminate accounts that violate these terms.
terms-4: 4. All user-generated content remains the property of their respective owners.
terms-5: 5. The collection and use of personal data is governed by our Privacy Policy.
terms-6: 6. We do not share personal data with third parties without the user's consent, except in cases required by law.
terms-7: 7. Lymbrarie does not guarantee that the service will be free of errors or interruptions.
terms-8: 8. We are not responsible for losses arising from the use of the platform.
terms-9: We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. Changes will be posted on the platform and your continued use of Lymbrarie implies your acceptance of them.
login-fn: You must be logged in to use all features
notes-book-0: One of the most beloved novels of classic literature, perfect for those who enjoy romantic stories and social criticism.
notes-guest: (You must be logged in to save notes)
notes-book-1: A dystopian classic that is still relevant today. Ideal for those looking for a deep and thoughtful read.
notes-book-2: A fast-paced novel that combines history, religion, and riddles in an intriguing plot.
name-book-3: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
notes-book-3: One of the most iconic books in the genre, ideal for appealing to both youngsters and adults who enjoy magic and adventure.
warning-login: Lymbrarie is NOT a social network to share reviews, follow users or give likes. It is a private space designed to record your reading.
